title: Lemon Granita
instructions: In a saucepan combine the water, sugar, and lemon rind and bring the water to a boil over moderate heat, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.  Simmer the syrup for 5 minutes and let it cool.  After it’s cooled stir in the lemon juice.   Remove the lemon rind.

Pour the mixture into two freezer trays and freeze it until it is firm but not frozen hard.  Transfer the mixture to a bowl and beat it smooth.  Again transfer the mixture back to the freezer trays and to the freezer.  Freeze the mixture for 3 hours more, or until it is firm.
Take from the freezer and let the freezer tray stand at room temperature for 5 minutes, or until it is just soft enough to scoop.
Remarks:  You may wish to use food coloring to enhance the granita’s color.
Source:  Gastronomie Sans Argent, Granitas, Gourmet Magazine, September 1978.
